meanings.sent1: I will make a cake for the party.
meanings.sent2: She likes to make drawings with colorful markers.
meanings.sent3: Let's make a deal: I'll wash the dishes if you dry them.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could make the sun jealous.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes make the painting come alive.

meanings.sent1: Eating too much candy can make you sick.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise made the dog bark.
meanings.sent3: His funny jokes always make everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her determination made the impossible possible.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds make the sky look ominous.

meanings.sent1: She will make a snowman in the yard.
meanings.sent2: The potter used clay to make a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent3: Let's make a heart shape with our hands for the photo.
meanings.sent4: His words make a bridge between two hearts.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor's hands make magic out of marble.

meanings.sent1: Studying hard will make you successful.
meanings.sent2: He worked overtime to make extra money.
meanings.sent3: Her dedication will make her dreams come true.
meanings.sent4: His efforts make him a valuable team member.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's training regimen will make him a champion.

meanings.definition: To force someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will make the students stay after class.
meanings.sent2: The robber made the cashier open the safe.
meanings.sent3: His parents will make him apologize for his mistake.
meanings.sent4: The dictator's orders make the citizens live in fear.
meanings.sent5: The hypnotist can make people do strange things.
